page.title: 20The Village School
page.content: The earliest records of the school date back to 1846. In 1960 the school was due to close under the development plan but was saved due to proposed remodelling. By 1963 Witchampton school had been refurbished and extended. The teaching space had been doubled and a new auxiliary block including cloakrooms, an office and a kitchen had been added. In November 1973 the three tier comprehensive system was introduced and the school became a first school. At the present time there are 38 children on the roll this will rise to 47 in February 1986. There are two full time members of staff and a part time teacher. In 1983 the school was made into one open plan area with one class base at either end of the school with a central resource area. The Head Teacher appointed in 1985 is Mrs Denise Whild.
